title: Champions League final: Dover Athletic face ruin in 'dog eat dog' football world
description: English clubs dominate Europe, but Dover Athletic face ruin at the bottom of the football pyramid.

title: After a 32-year battle for justice, what is Hillsborough's legacy?
description: As the collapse of the last criminal trial marks the end of a long legal road, Judith Moritz asks what the legacy of Britain’s worst sports disaster is.

title: Mud cylinders reveal humans' impact on Earth began earlier than we thought

title: Festivals face 'another lost summer' without government safety net, MPs say

title: Stonewall boss defends new strategy amid criticism

title: Emmys 2021: The binge-worthy TV shows in this year's race

title: Mantuan roundel: UK places export bar on £17m artefact
description: Ministers want the unique 15th Century piece depicting mythical gods to be "saved" for the nation.

title: NHS calls for ban on toy neodymium magnets amid child safety fears
description: In England, 65 children have needed urgent surgery after swallowing magnets in the last three years.

title: CCTV shows Khan before he carried out the attack
description: CCTV and other footage shown at the inquest shows Usman Khan before he carried out the attack.

title: Week in pictures: 22 - 28 May 2021

title: Tokyo 2020: Meet the armless archer aiming for gold at the Paralympics

title: Venezuela's paradise beach resort turns into violent nightmare

title: Is Kintyre's 'Route 66' the next road to recovery?
description: K66 is being promoted as a new scenic route on and around the Kintyre peninsula in Argyll.

title: Comedy of errors in Argentine TV Shakespeare mix-up

title: 'Chuck the belt and fight AJ' - Fury's father wants him to fight Joshua not Wilder
description: John Fury says he is concerned about his son Tyson's forthcoming fight with Deontay Wilder - and would prefer him to give up his WBC belt to fight Anthony Joshua.

title: Super-rare orange lobsters rescued from Leicester shop display

title: Glasgow: The city that has been locked down for nine months

description: PSG have no intention of letting boss Mauricio Pochettino leave for a return to Tottenham, says football journalist Guillem Balague.
